definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish

sentences.english: Noun The development of noun is mainly epitomized on prefix and suffix.
sentences.chinese: 名詞的發展主要表現在詞頭詞尾上。

sentences.english: In English, the verb inflects by endings.
sentences.chinese: 英語動詞靠詞尾發生變化。

sentences.english: Certain suffixes are typical of one or another gender.
sentences.chinese: 有些詞尾後綴，則是這個或那個“性”所特有的。

sentences.english: Word-final nasals are much shorter in Chinese than they are in English.
sentences.chinese: 中文中詞尾鼻音比英文中的短得多。

sentences.english: Latin is a more inflected language than English.
sentences.chinese: 拉丁語比英語詞尾變化多。

sentences.english: Read the endings of all these words distinctly.
sentences.chinese: 這些詞的詞尾都要讀清楚。

definition: language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1
